intro: Clypeola jonthlaspi var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy clypeola, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly rough texture. It is often found in open, sunny environments and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
